ygData.subject: SV: [archive-crawler] RE: How to pre-install your own scripts in the H3 GUI
ygData.msgSnippet: It would be nice to be able to upload an a script to the GUI and then execute it using REST. And then of course be able to get the result using REST as well.

It would be nice to be able to upload an a script to the GUI and then execu=
te it using REST.
And then of course be able to get the result using REST a=
s well.

/S=F8ren

Fra: archive-cra=
wler@yahoogroups.com [archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com]
Sendt: 9. september =
2015 19:09
Til: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Emne: Re: [archive-crawler]=
 RE: How to pre-install your own scripts in the H3 GUI

Well, some function=
ality you can do through writing some scripts, then
calling them
via the ru=
n script button.  But yeah, the UI is kind of locked in place.


Some thing=
s work, a bunch do not, as the code does make some assumptions.


A simple =
example, to disable cookies on a running job:
bean=3DappCtx.getBean('fetchH=
ttp')
bean.ignoreCookies=3Dtrue


Also add functions in the xml, and then c=
all those.


But its a bit indirect, and you do have to look at the code to=
 see what
works.
(or try it and see.)  And you can't just add a button here=
, to run this
thing.


John
